Title: Clinical Data Scientist - Contract
Description:
Work with clinical scientists internally and externally to define questions of interest and map approaches to answer them.
10-12 months contract position.
Descriptions:
Clinical Data Scientist
Remote position in USA
10-12 months contract position
Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people! Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry, by making clinical-grade genetic information affordable and accessible to guide health decisions across all stages of life.
We are looking for a data scientist with domain knowledge in healthcare to join our AI Computational Biology team. Our team includes computational biologists, computer scientists, and engineers working together to enhance and demonstrate the value of clinico-genomics data for precision medicine. In this contract position, you will work closely with an external partner to generate insights from clinical data to benefit patients and bring a better understanding of their disease.
What you'll do:
Responsible for the analysis of structured medical records to answer client inquiries regarding a cohort of blood cancer patients
Work with clinical scientists internally and externally to define questions of interest and map approaches to answer them
Query a database of structured patient medical records to describe variables and interactions between them
Develop and apply statistical models to identify associations between concepts such as treatment trajectories and healthcare outcomes, understand causal relationships, and predict clinical variables
Cooperate with other members of the AI Computational Biology team to generalize solutions, so that can be applied to similar problems in other clinical areas
Prepare reports, slide decks, presentations and present to clients
What you bring:
Master's or equivalent experience in biostatistics, computational biology, computer science, or in a related field
Strength in core statistical principles and methods such as data imputation, hypothesis testing, and regression modeling, and experience with prediction modeling
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Expert in Python 3 and common libraries (e.g. numpy, scipy, pandas) and data visualization
Experience working in a production development environment using version control
Excellent documentation practices, and presentation skills to non-technical audiences
Preferred skills:
Prior experience working with electronic medical records and familiarity with clinical data standards (ICD9/10, SNOMED, LOINC, FHIR, etc.)
Oncology experience preferred, hematological malignancies a plus.
Please apply even if you don't meet all of the "What you bring" requirements noted. It's rare that someone checks every single item, it's ok, we encourage you to apply anyways.
Join us!
At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

We truly believe a diverse workplace is crucial to our company's success and to better serve our diverse patients. Your input is especially valuable. We'd greatly appreciate it if you can take a quick moment to make your selection(s) below. Submissions will be anonymous.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Experience in developing analytics with machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and/or other related modeling techniques.
$250 Donation Match Program.
Descriptions:
At Teachable we empower creators to transform their knowledge into income. To accomplish this, our products enable individuals and small businesses to create, host and sell online courses and coaching. Teachable Creators have tens of thousands of active creators who’ve reached more than 45 million students around the world, teaching a diverse array of topics, ranging from crafting to card tricks to coding. Fifty million people worldwide consider themselves to be creators. More than two million people earn enough from their passion projects to consider it their full-time income. The rise of the creator economy means more people than ever want to share what they know and monetize it. Teachable is poised to offer best-in-class solutions to this ever-growing market.
In 2020, Teachable was acquired by Hotmart Company, a global leader in the Creator Economy with a shared mission of empowering creators to live out their passions. With offices in eight countries and more than 35 million users worldwide, Hotmart’s partnership ensures our creators—current and future—have access to best-in-class technology tools, so they can scale their online businesses with ease and truly make an impact on their students’ lives.
We’re looking for an experienced Data Scientist to work alongside our Product team in collaborating on our product roadmap and design in order to empower creators to transform their knowledge into income.
Primarily a Python shop, our team uses Apache Airflow for ETL, a rest endpoint, and Kafka for collecting events, and we deploy in Kubernetes. The data warehouse is Amazon Redshift with federated Postgres tables, and we have plenty of data in s3 in a variety of formats. This role has a major impact on the entire organization, as the Data Scientist is the primary owner of key pieces of infrastructure and is expected to make recommendations about what technologies we should be employing in the data platform and what patterns we should be following in data engineering.
This role will report to the Senior Business Intelligence Manager.
What you’ll do
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams
Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to data related to the optimization of checkout and user experiences
Make recommendations on focus areas in the product to improve the customer journey
Collect and clean data from various sources and translate into strategic insights and actionable product recommendations
Build, improve and maintain data-driven projects to help build critical solutions to difficult problems
What We’re Looking For
2+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Expert level of knowledge of Python or R
Experience in developing analytics with machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and/or other related modeling techniques
Experience preparing and cleaning data autonomously
Ability to translate business needs and requirements into technical solutions
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
Who upholds Teachable values, including working as part of a diverse team
Additional Details:
This role is open to remote candidates in the U.S.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.
For this role, the base salary range is $125,000 - $140,000. Total compensation also includes a competitive benefits package and Restricted Stock Units (RSUs). A salary offer will be determined by a number of factors including experience, skill level, education, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We review all teammate pay and compensation programs regularly to ensure competitive and fair pay.
At Teachable, we are committed to providing fair and competitive pay (using market data to inform our pay bands), rewarding high performance, and ensuring all employees have the opportunity and ability to impact Teachable’s overall company value. Base salaries will be reviewed at regular intervals throughout the year, typically following performance review cycles currently conducted bi-annually or in conjunction with a promotion.
While Teachable maintains our NY office for local employees to use, we operate as a remote-first culture in order to give our employees added flexibility. In order to maintain connection and create a community beyond the screen, Teachable holds company-wide, in-person events 2-3 times per year, where employees and teams can come together for team bonding, strategic alignment, goal-setting, and celebrations!
Benefits:
Comprehensive Health, Dental, & Vision benefits with an option covering up to 100% of monthly premiums Generous Vacation, Personal, and Sick Time
Parental leave, 16 weeks fully paid after three months of service
4% 401(k) with match after three months of service
Supplemental student loan repayment assistance or a professional education stipend
Tax-free commuter benefit
Gym/Wellness reimbursement up to $100 in pre-tax dollars per month
One-time $500 Work from Home (WFH) purchase card for new hires and ongoing WFH monthly reimbursement for certain home expenses of up to $100 per month
Headspace subscription
$250 Donation Match Program
_
Teachable encourages individuals from a broad diversity of backgrounds to apply for positions. We are an equal opportunity employer, meaning we're committed to a fair and consistent interview process. Please tell us in your application if you require an accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job._

Title: Data Scientist (Remote)
Description:
Support the machine learning team in designing machine learning algorithms.
Understanding of deep learning as well as traditional machine learning algorithms.
Descriptions:
Do you hate advertising? We do too. Our view is that the advertising business is broken and needs to change, and we are a big part of the answer. Jun Group means truth, and our culture is about openness, honesty and innovation. We work with the largest brands in the world to run advertisements that are 100% opt-in, putting consumers in control and turning the industry on its head.
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our machine learning and data science team. This position is full-time and 100% remote with the option of working on-site once it is safe to do so. Jun Group will only consider candidates for this position who are currently legally authorized to work in the United States.
Who you are
You enjoy collaboration with other teams including product, strategy, and machine learning engineers
You love solving complex problems and can present sophisticated ideas and data analysis in a way that's easy to understand
You are a pro at uncovering consumer behavior and campaign performance trends and insights-based strategy through quantitative research methods
You have a strong ability to think creatively with data, formulate and get traction around new ideas, and bring a different point of view to business and engineering partners
You're naturally curious and always find a way to contribute
You're detail-oriented and enjoy analysis and problem-solving
What you'll do
Work with product and data engineering stakeholders to identify key metrics and opportunities for improving business processes and drive product strategy
Take on projects end-to-end from business question all the way to production
Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytical systems and predictive models
Design and conduct surveys for market research, audience insights, and machine learning modeling
Evaluate surveys, methods, and performance to improve future surveys and remove sampling bias
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis and modeling
Apply quantitative methods including but not limited to descriptive analysis univariate and multivariate tests, statistical modeling etc. to find opportunities to optimize ad campaign performance and audience engagement
Support the machine learning team in designing machine learning algorithms
Create data visualizations, reports, dashboards, and data audits
Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Qualifications
Advanced quantitative degree in Data Science, Statistics, Psychology, Mathematics, or related field or relevant combination of education or professional experience
3+ years of relevant professional experience
Practical knowledge of research methods, survey methodology, probability, and statistical modeling
You're comfortable writing SQL and manipulating large, real world datasets in a data warehouse like BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake, etc.
You're comfortable working with Python and using popular machine learning tools like Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.
Understanding of deep learning as well as traditional machine learning algorithms
Experience with data visualization tools like Datastudio, Looker, Tableau, etc
Excellent communication and writing skills, in particular, the ability to communicate technical content to a non-technical audience
What we offer
A highly competitive compensation package
401k with company match
Paid vacation, work from home, and sick days
Designated time to work on company-related projects you feel strongly about
Macbook Pros and any other equipment you need to work effectively from home
NY-area Residents: We currently have a hybrid remote work policy. All Jun Group employees living within a 90-minute (one way) commute of our NYC office are expected to be in the office two days per week.
Salary Range: $80,000 - $110,000 + incentive pay
Learn what our engineering team likes about Jun Group here.
Jun Group is a high-powered, collaborative environment. We are looking for candidates who work well in teams, enjoy learning, and challenge the status quo. We work hard, and we have lives, too. We pay competitively based on experience, and we're open to allowing the right person to learn our industry on the job.
We have excellent perks and benefits, and we welcome diversity and non-traditional paths into all of our roles. We believe in hiring the right person as opposed to the right combination of keywords.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description: Bring 3-4+ years of industry experience in statistics, experiment design, distributed machine learning and data engineering.
Descriptions:
The Mission:
As a Data Scientist on the Attributes team, your mission is to work with your teammates to solve our hardest data science challenges, including:
Predicting business behavior from dozens of data sources and validating them against ground truth
Exploring new data sets and extracting the signal that powers our products
Helping to build the data science culture and infrastructure to rapidly move from hypothesis to impact
The Role:
At the core of Enigma's product is our data which makes data science the beating heart of Enigma's product. You will build the most reliable and comprehensive dataset about businesses in the US. In that pursuit, you will design and execute experiments to extract signals from hundreds of data sources, design and develop tooling to make the team more effective, and closely collaborate with product managers and engineers.
We are looking for someone who:
Finds innovative solutions to problems in statistics, experiment design and distributed machine learning (we use Python libraries and Spark extensively)
Sets high personal standards for research design that increase iteration speed and ensure reproducibility of results
Approaches data as an artefact of the real-world and develop repeatable strategies for validating results against ground truth
Develops techniques to detect and explore anomalies in our data, uncover the source and address in a way that improves our product
Thrives in high-performing, collaborative teams with short, high-impact research cycles
What makes this job interesting?
Technical challenge: Enigma is solving some of the hardest problems in the world related to entity resolution and pushing to make new discoveries. You will be critical to our success.
Impact: Data science at many companies focuses on making better product development and business decisions. At Enigma, data science is the core of our actual product!
Learning: We're tackling problems with exciting data that don't have obvious solutions. Every day brings new opportunities to learn about data science and our world.
Our ideal candidate will:
Bring 3-4+ years of industry experience in statistics, experiment design, distributed machine learning and data engineering
Effectively communicate with technical and non-technical audiences
Have an advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, etc.)
Bonus points if you:
Have experience combining diverse sets of data at scale
About Us:
At Enigma, we're building the single, most reliable source of data on businesses to power the future of financial services. By engineering better data from hundreds of public and third-party sources, we aim to tell the complete story of every business, so that companies of every size can access the financial services they need to grow and thrive. Our core values - generosity, curiosity, ingenuity, & drive - guide everything we do from how we make our most important product decisions to how we work with and support one another on a daily basis. We're a team of curious, driven individuals with diverse backgrounds and skills, but we're all passionate about engineering deeper understanding through data—together. If this resonates, we would love to hear from you!
We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Salary Range: $180,000-$240,000
A note on salary ranges: we pride ourselves on paying competitively for our size and industry. Salary is one piece of a total Enigma compensation package that includes additional benefits and opportunities. All of our compensation packages include equity because we believe 100% of Enigma employees should have the option to purchase ownership in the company and benefit from the value we're creating together.

Descriptions:
Data Scientist
SummaryThe Data Scientist is responsible for the research, creation and implementation of analytical solutions designed to optimize marketing communications and/or drive marketing insights for existing clients. This individual will participate in the design and development of processes to automate analytical functions as well as contribute and assist in the creation of new products and services rooted in analytical work. Review and perform quality checks on existing data sources. Assist in leveraging existing data sources to their fullest potential for use within models and targeting decisions. This includes the generation of new information as well as the creation of models to be used as inputs in other processes.
Assist in evaluation of new data sources within existing processes and make recommendations for licensing.
Provide input to the Predictive Client Solutions Team and Client Success to assist in the fulfillment of client orders including recommendations for model prioritization and offline customized selects.

1+ years’ experience demonstrated professional presentation skills with an emphasis on effectively communicating analytical results to key stakeholders.
Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills.

Title: Sr. Data Scientist
Description: Strong conceptual understanding of machine learning applied to real-world data, including the ability to identify and articulate modeling and data issues.
Descriptions:
Who's Clearcover?
Clearcover is the smarter car insurance company. We use powerful technology to offer everyday drivers better coverage for less money. We're proud to be one of the fastest growing startups in Chicago, and we're currently looking to add a few more extraordinary people to our team.
What is a Sr. Data Scientist at Clearcover?
Clearcover has an enormous range of opportunities around data science and machine learning ranging from marketing and acquisition, fraud detection, customer experience, and claims payment. As a Sr. Data Scientist, you will work closely and independently with our business partners, product teams, data engineers, and machine learning engineers to build and deploy machine learning and AI models to create and deliver real and measurable value for our customers. You will lead, coach, and mentor more junior data scientists while working independently on complex data science problems. We're looking for someone curious and passionate about data and machine learning and using them to solve real world problems.
What will you do?
Lead, coach, and mentor junior data scientists
Review machine learning models and code
Work with our product managers and business stakeholders to identify and scope the highest value data science problems
Explore and understand our data and how they can feed production-grade machine learning models
Proactively utilize data and business understanding for feature engineering
Build, prototype, and deploy state-of-the-art machine learning models to solve real business problems
Communicate, interpret, and explain modeling output to stakeholders
Measure value of the machine learning models we deploy
What do you need?
3+ years of professional experience working as a data scientist
Experience mentoring, managing, or leading data scientists
Experience reviewing others' models and code
Expertise in building and deploying machine learning models that have been adopted or implemented, and achieved measurable value
Experience using the Python data science stack; including pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, XGBoost, notebook environments, etc.
Experience with Python, including object-oriented programming
Knowledge of SQL, including Snowflake or similar systems
Expertise with different types of machine learning techniques
Strong conceptual understanding of machine learning applied to real-world data, including the ability to identify and articulate modeling and data issues
Ability to work in and lead teams
Ability to quickly learn and keep up with the latest ML and AI technology
Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Nice to Haves?
Experience working in insurance, marketing, or fraud
An advanced degree
Did you know that women and minorities are less likely to apply to a position if they don't match 100% of the job qualifications? Don't let that be the reason you miss out on this opportunity! We encourage you to apply anyway. Don't count yourself out!
But wait, there's more:
As a people-first company, your health and well-being is a priority at Clearcover. We offer comprehensive benefits for individuals and families:
Medical. We offer rich and affordable BCBS plans for you and your dependents. If you select the high deductible health plan, we offer an HRA and contribute to your HSA.
Dental and vision. We cover 100% of dental and vision premiums for you and your dependents.
Pre-tax benefits, disability, and life insurance.
401(k). We contribute 3%, even if you contribute nothing.
We've also curated a stack of perks and benefits that stretch beyond the expected. Our people have access to:
Generous vacation, 12 paid holidays, and parental leave.
Equity in the company (plus an evergreen plan) and an annual bonus program.
Employee resource groups, live yoga, and mental health workshops.
Top of the line hardware, snack stipends, and meeting free "Focus Fridays".
We're a remote first company, having paved the way for flexible work locations and continue to offer this flexibility. If you are local or in town visiting, you also have the choice to work from our Chicago HQ office.
Remote employees are eligible to work from: AZ, CO, CT, FL, GA, IA, IL, IN, KS, MA, MI, MN, MO, NC, NJ, OK, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WI.
To top it all off, if Clearcover is available in your state, you could have access to an employee discount on auto-insurance! Excited to learn more? Complete the application below!

Clearcover is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reasons prohibited by law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
3+ years’ analytics experience in database marketing, data science, analysis and modeling.
Review and perform quality checks on existing data sources.
Descriptions:
Data Scientist
SummaryThe Data Scientist is responsible for the research, creation and implementation of analytical solutions designed to optimize marketing communications and/or drive marketing insights for existing clients. This individual will participate in the design and development of processes to automate analytical functions as well as contribute and assist in the creation of new products and services rooted in analytical work. The Data Scientist will consult with Client Success in the development and usage of predictive modeling products with the goal of maximizing client results. Finally, they will interpret promotional results and provide recommendations to enhance performance.
Job Responsibilities
Assist in the design, development and enhancement of processes to make Wiland’s Enterprise analytical platform robust and to scale to meet company growth. This includes, but is not limited to, development of new analytic and modeling capabilities as well as consulting with internal technology personnel.
Assist in the evaluation of various statistical techniques including proprietary algorithms in the context of prospect and customer models.
Complete research and analysis to provide insights leading to new product and services.
Review and perform quality checks on existing data sources. Assist in leveraging existing data sources to their fullest potential for use within models and targeting decisions. This includes the generation of new information as well as the creation of models to be used as inputs in other processes.
Assist in evaluation of new data sources within existing processes and make recommendations for licensing.
Provide input to the Predictive Client Solutions Team and Client Success to assist in the fulfillment of client orders including recommendations for model prioritization and offline customized selects.
Present analytical results internally to the Analysis Team, Client Success and Senior Management as needed. Develop presentation skills and business knowledge to eventually deliver Client presentations and consultations
Education, Experience & Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree (or higher) in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or Computer Science) with strong work experience. Must be able to produce college transcripts showing minimum 3.0 GPA.
3+ years’ experience with R, Python, or related statistical software package including extensive programming skills.
Hadoop, Spark or other big data implementation experience desirable
3+ years’ experience developing successful predictive models using regression analysis, decision trees and/or neural networks in an academic setting or prior work.
3+ years’ experience with databases, data access tools, and SQL.
3+ years’ analytics experience in database marketing, data science, analysis and modeling.
1+ years’ experience demonstrated professional presentation skills with an emphasis on effectively communicating analytical results to key stakeholders.
Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills.
Additional Details
Location: Remote
Department: Information Technology
Compensation Range: $82,000- $113,500. Total compensation for this role also includes a variable component.
Our benefits include: Medical, Dental and Vision, Flexible Spending Account, Basic and Voluntary Life/AD&D Insurance, Short & Long-Term Disability, 401(k) Retirements Savings Plan with company match, Paid Parental Leave, Flexible Time Off (FTO) and 11 Designated Company Holidays.
Must be a US citizen or authorized to work in the United States.
Wiland is an equal opportunity employer.
Apply Now!
We want to learn more about you! We are seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude, and take pride in their work. Please submit your application using the button below.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $82,000.00 - $113,500.00 per year

Title: Data Specialist
Description: You will be expected to develop an understanding of Praedicat’s clients and proprietary analytics and think creatively about how Praedicat can solve their…
Descriptions:
Title: Data Specialist
Location: Los Angeles (remote)
Team: Modeling
Reports to: Vice President, Emerging Risk
Full-time or Part-time*
Exempt or Non-exempt*
We are Praedicat, a funded InsurTech startup headquartered in Los Angeles, with additional offices in New York and London. Our business is helping other businesses make the world cleaner, safer and healthier, and we do it with a foundation deeply rooted in science, technology, analytics and a business-minded approach to client service. We deliver innovative new predictive models that use cutting edge quantitative analytics and technologies to help our clients future-proof their business. Our people are our greatest assets, and we enjoy a unique and special culture that thrives on hard work, being kind and staying curious. If that sounds like you, read on.
Making a difference: Our products deliver data from peer-reviewed science into the workflow of businesses, empowering our clients to make better decisions that result in cleaner technologies, safer products, a healthier environment while driving profitable and sustainable growth. That’s making a difference.
Multidisciplinary collaboration: We believe in collegiality and multidisciplinary collaboration. We work really well together even though our areas of expertise vary dramatically. We leave our egos at the door because when we listen to understand, rather than to respond, we learn from each other and build off each other’s ideas. And that leads to solutions.
Hard problems and cutting-edge technologies: What’s the next asbestos? Imagine if you could answer that billion-dollar question. How might you use that knowledge? How many lives would be saved? When you are tackling hard problems and trying to answer hard questions, you employ every tool in your tool kit…and our tool kit is chock-full of cutting-edge technology like artificial intelligence, machine learning, big data manipulation…and heart.
We are looking to hire a Data Specialist who will report to the VP, Emerging Risk. You will be expected to develop an understanding of Praedicat’s clients and proprietary analytics and think creatively about how Praedicat can solve their problems through data-driven solutions delivered through software and analytics.
Applicants will be asked to complete a short technical exercise as part of the application process
Responsibilities
Work with other modeling team members to analyze data sources, design and implement data models, and build repeatable processes for assimilating and maintaining data
Collect data to inform quantitative models of exposure and damages
Perform various tasks of data ingestion, data transformation, and data visualizations
Conduct data analysis, data integration, data management and feature engineering
Understand and programmatically implement mathematical, statistical data, and computational solutions
Create internal documentation for data sets and completed analyses
Requirements
Bachelor of Science or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (bioinformatics, bioengineering, chemistry, engineering, mathematics, physics, economics, etc.) plus 2 years of experience or equivalent
Ability to solve problems thoroughly, quickly, and creatively with an eye for detail
Hands on experience in many aspects of data management activities involving large data sets (e.g., data gathering and profiling, data analysis, pipeline creation, data validation)
Experience with and mastery of general-purpose programming languages for data analysis, such as Python or C#
Experience using data analysis packages and ability to independently produce in-depth analyses of large data sets
Proven track record of leveraging large amounts of data to solve real-world problems
Strong written and verbal communication skills to support interactions with subject matter experts and create documentation as needed
Preferred Skills
Subject matter knowledge in environmental science, chemistry and/or medicine-related areas
Facility with SQL, data manipulation, and data analysis for business intelligence
Expertise in data modeling, integration, and cleansing
Experience with modeling approaches such as regression analysis, principal component analysis, clustering, etc.
Incentive Compensation and Benefits
Praedicat believes in a work-life balance that is supported by a competitive compensation and benefits package. All full-time permanent employees are eligible for benefits such as:
Participation in Praedicat’s Stock Incentive Plan offering equity-based incentives for employees
The ability to contribute to a Praedicat-sponsored 401(k) plan
Medical insurance coverage, with HMO, PPO and HDHP options, as well as dental and vision coverage
Company-paid basic life, accidental death & dismemberment, and long-term disability insurance plans
Allotment of PTO (paid time off) and official holidays each year
Eight hours of paid time off to volunteer at a non-profit organization, per calendar year
About Praedicat®
Praedicat, Inc. is dedicated to improving the underwriting and management of liability catastrophe risk. Our multidisciplinary team leverages cutting-edge analytics to solve problems for clients. Our patent-pending technology delivers information extracted from scientific literatures on emerging risk. We analyze the risk with a structured approach incorporating applied legal reasoning and economics. Our analysis is focused to directly inform core business functions of liability insurers and reinsurers. Praedicat is developing a comprehensive system of software products, Litagion®Risk Management, designed to bring 21st Century science-based risk analytics to liability insurance. Praedicat was created by the RAND Corporation and Risk Management Solutions, Inc. after the two companies collaborated on research and development to improve the identification and prioritization of emerging risks using modeling and cutting-edge computer science. Praedicat is an independent corporation launched in March 2012.
Praedicat is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with Praedicat is determined on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.
Job Type: Full-time

401(k)
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Flexible schedule
Flexible spending account
Health insurance

Professional development assistance
Referral program
Vision insurance

Monday to Friday

"Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status)?

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Federal Civilian (remote)
Description: Collaborate with team of data analysts, data scientists/statisticians, and/or data engineering team depending on project to improve data workflows and…
Descriptions:
This is a remote position.
Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our team of experts from across the commercial industry and government brings the modern skills necessary to help agencies transform public services into digital services. Our work enables agencies to meet the needs of their users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government.
What you'll do
Our ideal Senior Data Analyst will lead the effort to create, iterate on, and maintain a Data Dictionary. They will be responsible for providing detailed analysis of existing schemas, common fields, unique fields, schema mapping and discovering data formatting differences with agency data. The Senior Data Analyst will define field terms, identify conflicts, and provide recommendations for cleanup solutions to align with shared, interagency understandings.
Work with Product Managers and Data Analysts to understand the baselines, norms, and pain points of the data
Participate in research to understand agency-specific data requirements
Determine what data is unique within agencies, what data is shared and what can be consolidated
Determine list of data fields
Iteratively develop the new data standard to scale and meet requirements
Document reporting needs
Define permission policies
Develop a centralized governance process
Lead the effort to develop a Data Dictionary
What You'll Bring
Prior experience with payroll data preferred
Experience in guiding migrations from on premises to cloud
Advanced skills in using statistical software languages like R or Python to analyze, manipulate, or process large sets of data
Extensive SQL aptitude with the ability to write scalable, maintainable queries
Experience with data lakes, databases, and APIs to ingest and transform data
Demonstrates experience in gathering information from end users and project stakeholders, identifying (and validating existing) requirements, and translating these into relevant data analysis and reporting
Analyze large and complex data sets and communicate results and findings to senior leaders and executives, including through the use of visualizations
Collaborate with team of data analysts, data scientists/statisticians, and/or data engineering team depending on project to improve data workflows and standardize processes for analysis as well as perform ad hoc analysis
Working with varied data sources including web analytics and user data to analyze usage and present findings with visualization software such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, Domo, etc
Collaborate with the stakeholders and multidisciplinary team to develop, integrate and continually improve data management processes
Develop metrics and algorithms to understand user demand, user behavior, and provide insights into user experiences or product and user trends
Visualizes, interprets, and reports data findings via dashboards, reports, and charts
Demonstrates understanding of the design and UX implications of different data visualizations, including best practices for reports/dashboards and charts
Deliver and explain data analytics methodologies and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members
Advanced experience in descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive analytics
Mentor and coach other data analyst on skills and development
Participate in interviewing for data roles and data capability development at Ad Hoc
Requirements
4 years of previous or relevant experience REQUIRED
High School Diploma or Equivalent
Our Federal contracts require that you be a U.S. Citizen to be eligible for employment.
All work must be conducted within the U.S.
As a government contractor, all hires may be required to meet additional pre-employment contingencies to the extent required by applicable law, at the time of hire or any time thereafter

Title: Data Science - General Interest - Talent Community
Description:

Descriptions:
Sezzle invites you to join our Talent Community!

At Sezzle, we are always seeking talented, motivated people to join our company. Our Buy Now Pay Later product is driven by data - and our Data Science team is a critical part of how we do what we do. If you are ready to join a company that moves QUICKLY and where you can truly make an impact - you've found the place. You Matter Here!
By applying to this posting - you are signaling that you have general interest in a role at Sezzle. Whether you are seeking an internship or a senior level strategic role - we'd love to speak with you. This posting is not connected to a specific role - it's a way for us to get introduced for any current or future opportunities. We look forward to getting to know you!
About Sezzle:
Sezzle is a cutting-edge fintech company whose long-standing mission is to financially empower the next generation. Only one in three millennials own a credit card, and the vast majority of millennials possess a subprime credit score or no score at all. To address these problems, Sezzle has built a payment platform that increases purchasing power for consumers by offering interest-free installment plans at online stores. This increase in purchasing power for consumers leads to increased sales and basket sizes for the numerous eCommerce merchants that currently work with Sezzle.
As the first and only B-Corp in the payments space, Sezzle's goal is to help everyone pursue financial freedom, and to invest in social good and ethical initiatives that shape a better world.
At Sezzle, we're committed to putting purpose alongside profitability. We work hard to maintain rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency to build a better world. The employees at Sezzle lean into significant societal and cultural shifts, ensuring internal and external focus on positive impacts that benefit our community.
Perks & Benefits:
Competitive salary and RSUs
Generous paid time off, sick time and volunteer hours
Life, STD/LTD, medical, dental and vision insurance
Highly discounted LifeTime gym membership
Work From Home stipend
401k with impressive employer match
Remote first work

What Makes Working at Sezzle Awesome?
At Sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators; we are skilled musicians, yogis, cyclists, chefs, golfers, dog-lovers, and rock-climbers. We believe in surrounding ourselves with not only the best and the brightest individuals, but those that are unique and purpose-driven in all that they do. Our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire. Sezzle provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information or characteristics, marital status, familial status, veteran or military status, status regarding public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Lead Agile development process for a cross-functional team of subject matter experts and data scientists.
Extensive hands-on experience with data science and…
Descriptions:
Machinify is a revolutionary healthcare software company with a mission to ensure that patients get the right treatment, at the right time, at the right price. The cloud-based Machinify AI platform delivers products that are transforming healthcare administration from a human-powered, error-prone series of workflows fueled by faxes and spreadsheets to a world of transparent, realtime care and payment decisions.
What You’ll Do:
Machinify is seeking a Staff Data Scientist to lead efforts on our flagship data science product. Candidates should have prior experience proactively driving a technical project to production and delivering measurable business impact. Will be required to work hands-on and obtain a deep understanding of healthcare data and work hands-on. Responsibilities include:
Generate revenue for the Machinify Payment Integrity business by building models to identify erroneous medical claims for our insurance payer customers.
Identify business opportunities and prioritize work through analysis of large scale healthcare data.
Contribute to a scaled and automated modeling architecture with production-quality code.
Lead Agile development process for a cross-functional team of subject matter experts and data scientists.
Communicate findings and business results to non-technical stakeholders.

Minimum Qualifications:
We are a startup and expect each team member to move fast, take initiative, and spot and solve problems. You can expect the same from us.
Key skills and minimum qualifications include:
Extensive hands-on experience with data science and analytics in a business environment.
Experience leading projects and delivering technical products with measurable impact.
Analytical, first principles approach to problem solving and data-driven decision making.
Able to write efficient and effective queries on complex data. Strong in python or other languages for scripting.
Experience with cloud-based services and enterprise software environments.
Ability to balance trade-offs among multiple competing priorities.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or STEM disciplines
Experience with ML pipelines and Big Data.
Plus if the candidate has worked with medical records and/or insurance claims.
Startup experience

What It’s Like to Work Here:
The best companies are those that put talented people in a position where they can do their best work, challenge themselves, develop and grow, and make important contributions to the success of the company. Machinify is just this place. Specifically:

Everyone has a voice. Decisions are based on who makes the best argument vs who has the biggest title.
We encourage personal responsibility and flexibility over defined rules and practices, and impact over process.
We are a team of diverse backgrounds and perspectives but a common focus on the customer.
You’ll be trusted to make big decisions on your own but with the proper support. We make decisions quickly without being rash.
We understand that things sometimes go wrong. Our team members hold themselves accountable for their performance, but also see every setback or mistake as a learning opportunity.
What we offer:
Work from anywhere in the US! Machinify is digital-first.
Flexible and trusting environment where you’ll feel empowered to do your best work
Unlimited PTO, recharge days and one no-meetings day a week
Medical/Dental/Vision for employees & their families
Competitive salary, equity, 401(k) sponsorship
Generous Learning and Development Reimbursement policy
Equal Employment Opportunity at Machinify
Machinify is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its positions. Machinify believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.

Title: Data Science Engineer
Description: A Master’s degree in engineering or science, and 3+ years of relevant training or experience working with sensor data and developing machine learning systems in…
Descriptions:
About this role
Are you interested in applying your signal processing and predictive modeling skills to design next-generation algorithms for cardiac health assessment? Are you a tenacious and self-catalyzing problem solver? If so, this role at Sensydia is for you. As a Data Science Engineer, you’ll work collaboratively with our team of engineers to derive insights from biosensor data collected using Sensydia’s Cardiac Performance System – a device that provides fast and safe cardiac assessment to improve lives of people with compromised heart function.
In this role, you will
Perform signal processing to analyze heart-sound waveform data
Develop signal features that predict cardiac conditions
Design machine learning algorithms and apply statistical methods to evaluate system performance
To be considered, you’ll need
A Master’s degree in engineering or science, and 3+ years of relevant training or experience working with sensor data and developing machine learning systems in a research setting
Knowledge of MATLAB for signal processing, data mining, feature engineering, and predictive modeling
Knowledge of statistical methods for evaluating classifier performance
Familiarity with cardiac anatomy and physiology
Join a rapidly growing company that’s democratizing cardiac performance assessment.
Sensydia is a high-performance and high-trust company. We develop great products through excellence in research, engineering, and clinical development. We value talent, diversity, passion, ingenuity, authenticity, integrity, and humility. We value the health of our team members and encourage time for family, friends, and adventure. We believe in teamwork over ego, perseverance over panic, and resolution over blame. We move fast and lean, celebrate our wins, and learn from failure.
Interested in applying? Apply here on Indeed or send your resume to info(at)sensydia.com

Descriptions:
Data Scientist (Remote)
RICHMOND VA
L*ocal candidates strongly preferred.*
Assist with complex data cleaning, integration, and analysis of public health data. The Data Scientist will collaborate with stakeholders, subject matter experts, and data stewards to ensure data projects are accurate and fulfill business needs for various data projects, including COVID-19.
Some responsibilities are but not limited to -
Leverages appropriate analytic and visualization tools (SQL, R, Python, Tableau, others) to develop complex data cleaning, integration, and analysis projects. Applies appropriate coding and statistical methodology to fulfill stakeholder requirements.
Coordinates with business stakeholders and subject matter experts to define requirements, organize and lead meetings, present findings, solicit feedback, and establish enhancement cycles.
Communicates data project results for a variety of audiences. Builds visualizations, collaborates on report writing, presents to internal and external stakeholders, and pursues publication as applicable. Audiences may include specific VDH programs, VDH leadership, other government agencies, the general public, healthcare providers, community action groups, and/or academic journals.
Builds relationships and collaborates with diverse internal and external stakeholders including subject-matter experts, data stewards, and others as applicable.
Contributes to team documentation. Ensures that scripts are commented out and routine processes are described step-wise. Includes data cleaning steps, sources, filters, assumptions, and purposes in documentation.
Proactively identifies process, database, and analysis improvements. Identifies, communicates, and implements innovative strategies without overstepping programmatic ownership.
Conducts other duties as requested/assigned

Bachelor’s Degree with coursework in biostatistics or equivalent combination of experience and education
Strong data analysis skills in SQL, Tableau, R, REDCap, and Microsoft Excel
Willingness to work occasional weekends and holidays
Experience working collaboratively with diverse groups and projects with defined timelines and deadlines simultaneously
Preferred Qualifications (Skills, Experience, Education, Certifications)
Master’s Degree with coursework in biostatistics or equivalent
Proficiency with SQL, R, Tableau Desktop, Tableau Prep, and REDCap
Familiarity with health/public health data

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Make significant and early contributions to the role of data science and machine learning at Mothership.
Ability to select, train, and evaluate machine learning…
Descriptions:
We are building the future of freight

Mothership's groundbreaking technology is unlocking the world's potential by making freight delivery more efficient. Founded in 2017, we're backed by some of venture capital's best investors and have already become the logistics backbone for many of today's most innovative companies.

Mothership is looking for its first Data Scientist to join the fulfillment team. They will help us better understand our carriers, optimize our routes, improve our dispatching strategies, forecast demand, and predict traffic conditions.

We are looking for someone with a passion for data and developing powerful, mission-critical machine learning models. This role aims to improve our logistics and make Mothership the fastest, most trusted freight provider in the United States.

Our team works in a collaborative, fast-paced environment, so great communication skills and a willingness to take risks and push boundaries are a must.
What You'll Do
Make significant and early contributions to the role of data science and machine learning at Mothership
Work with product and engineering teams across the company to make data-driven decisions
Hands-on work with geospatial data
Design, implement, and evaluate A/B tests
Feature engineering
Machine learning modeling
Build dashboards and data visualizations
Help to build and grow a data science team
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Statistics, Computer Science, or equivalent
5+ years of working in the data science field within a well-established and/or high-growth company
Proficiency in data science, machine learning, descriptive and inferential statistics, and A/B testing
Experience using statistical techniques to answer business questions and make data-driven decisions
Ability to select, train, and evaluate machine learning models for a variety of use cases
Ability to jump in and fix or extend open-source projects
Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate complex technical information to both professionals and non-specialists
Technologies We're Working With
Databricks
Looker
Python
SQL
Jupyter Notebooks
Pandas
Scikit-Learn
SciPy
H3 hexagonal hierarchical geospatial indexing system
Tensorflow
PyTorch
Benefits & Perks
Competitive salary and employee stock options
Health, dental, and vision insurance coverage (PPO)
Flexible paid time off
Short-term disability coverage
401(k) plan
Equipped with the latest technology
Compensation Philosophy

At Mothership, we believe it's vital to offer a range of compensation packages, so you have the power to make the appropriate financial decision for yourself and your family. Upon offer, you will receive a breakdown of 5 different cash vs. equity packages to choose from, with additional information on estimated equity valuation.

The cash portion for this role ranges from $188,000 - $235,000.

We offer equity options in ISO that vest over four years with a one-year cliff. The % and value will be discussed later in the interview process.

Culture at Mothership

We’re an ambitious, endlessly curious, and open-minded group. Our team is passionate about our mission and eager to produce work at the highest level. The environment is upbeat and supportive because we care about each other and believe positive momentum equals better outcomes.

If this sounds like a place you’d be a great addition to, let’s chat.
#LI-Remote

Descriptions:
We are seeking…
A driven and talented team player to add to our Software Engineering team. The machine learning data scientist provide business and technical expertise in developing and productizing custom machine learning models that satisfy business requirements.
You will:
Execute complex machine learning and learning projects that have a significant impact on AvaSure’s product line up.
Collaborate with stakeholders to determine and refine machine learning objectives.
Define and provide statistical analysis on the data required for machine learning model development.
Preprocess structured and unstructured data.
Process, clean, and validate the integrity of data to be used for analysis.
Design custom tools for data mining, cleaning, annotating, and validating data.
Write clear, maintainable, and tested code.
Recommend machine learning models based on business requirements.
Prototype and develop custom algorithms and machine learning models.
Analyze data gathered during tests to identify strengths and weaknesses of ML models.
Fine tune machine learning models.
You are:
Ethical.
Motivated.
Organized.
Passionate about your work.
Experienced in Active Listening Skills.
Able to Take Initiative and Act Accordingly.
You have:
Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, AI, or a related field.
Two years of experience working with computer vision, deep neural networks, and reinforcement learning.
Advanced proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, ML tools, and databases.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques and their real-world tradeoffs.
Experience working with computer vision datasets.
Critical thinking skills and are comfortable supporting collaborative problem solving in a team environment.
Understanding of your own limits and are comfortable asking for assistance when needed.
Nice to haves:
Experience using Nvidia Triton Inference server or other AI cloud platforms.
Experience with AI at the edge.
